what: Create a Bootstrap Off-Canvas Element — off_canvas
title: Create a Bootstrap Off-Canvas Element — off_canvas
text: Creates -canvas element, sliding panel appears edges viewport. wrapper Bootstrap's -canvas component.

title: Create a Bootstrap Off-Canvas Element — off_canvas
code: off_canvas(   id,   title,   ...,   width = "w-25",   position = c("start", "top", "bottom", "end") )

title: Create a Bootstrap Off-Canvas Element — off_canvas
text: id Character string. ID -canvas element. ID used show/hide element via JavaScript. title Character string. title display header -canvas element. ... Additional UI elements include body -canvas element. width Character string. Bootstrap width class apply -canvas element. Defaults "w-100" (100% width). Common values include "w-75", "w-50", etc. position Character string. position -canvas element appear. Must one "start" (left), "end" (right), "top", "bottom". Defaults "start".

title: Create a Bootstrap Off-Canvas Element — off_canvas
text: HTML tag object representing -canvas element.

title: Create a Bootstrap Off-Canvas Element — off_canvas
code: if (interactive()) {   library(shiny)   library(bslib)    ui <- page_fillable(     actionButton(      "toggle",      "Toggle offcanvas",      `data-bs-toggle` = "offcanvas",      `data-bs-target` = "#demo",      `aria-controls` = "demo"     ),     off_canvas(       id = "demo",       title = "Settings",       position = "end",       sliderInput("n", "Number", 1, 100, 50)     )   )    server <- function(input, output) {}    shinyApp(ui, server) }
